kultstatus77 wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm quite familiar with the purpose of tearDown(), I just fail to see
> the necessity of it. According to M. Feathers' "Working effectively
> with legacy code" unit tests don't access databases or communicate via
> a nreal network connection. 

Perhaps that's true. I suppose it all depends on how you define "unit 
test". personally I'm not so fanatical about the unitarity of my tests. 
My test suites frequently do make network connections. It's still TDD, 
even if it's not quite UTDD.
